--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, Dean Wayland <dean@t...>
wrote:
> Hi Kitsuno,
>
> In message <dge6u6+5cre@e...>, Kitsuno <samurai-
> listowner@s...> writes
> >It is unfortunate and ironic that the web-mistress of that great
> >site is ill tempered, to put it mildly.
>
> I take it you offered your services to aid in doing some
translating or
> something like that (as per her request on the homepage)? What
happened?
>
> Yours
>
> Dean

Nothing like that, actually. A number of years ago on the Delphi
Forum she went ninja on us, apparently in an attempt to show us
her "REAL ULTIMATE POWER".

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Searching for any info?

messages.messageBody:
Hi Kitsuno,

In message <dge6u6+5cre@...>, Kitsuno <samurai-
listowner@...> writes
>It is unfortunate and ironic that the web-mistress of that great
>site is ill tempered, to put it mildly.

I take it you offered your services to aid in doing some translating or
something like that (as per her request on the homepage)? What happened?

Yours

Dean
***
http://www.thefightschool.demon.co.uk

It is unfortunate and ironic that the web-mistress of that great

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Searching for any info?
messages.msgSnippet: Dear All, This website on the Ogasawara family tree was discovered by a friend of mine. Maybe it s of interest to many people.  It s an incredible piece of
messages.messageBody:
Dear All,

This website on the Ogasawara family tree was discovered by a friend of mine.
Maybe it's of interest to many people. It's an incredible piece of work. Just
amazing - to a humble gaijin such as myself whose ancestors have been lost in
the mists of time...

http://members.aol.com/uchuujin/mysenzo2.html

The home link is:

http://members.aol.com/uchuujin/home.html

Regards,

Barry Thomas
(Melbourne, Australia)

----- Original Message -----
From: "kosaka_samurai" <kosaka_samurai@...>
To: <samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, September 10, 2005 4:08 PM
Subject: [samuraihistory] Searching for any info?


Searching for any one who knows the family crest or banner of my
Japanesse family, "Kosaka". I am intrested in knowing these
description. I am tring to help build my family tree, and my family's
samurai heritage.
